channel.title: TravelgateX Documentation â€“ Stats
channel.description: Recent changes in Stats on TravelgateX Documentation

item.title: Stats: Overview
item.description: In order to analyze useful metrics about performance, Stats extracts, loads and stores data from all TravelgateX products. Once the metrics are stored in our infrastructure, you can query and analyze your performance using API stats query or TravelgateX Stats Web Working with Stats The most important use case working with Stats is to query about your performance.

item.title: Stats: How-to guides
item.description: The guides <a href="/stats/howtos/howto-query-stats/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-search-plus"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Query Stats</h3> <p>How to query about your performance</p> </div> </div> </a>

item.title: Stats: Reference
item.description:
Our reference pages explain all aspects of our GraphQL schema. These pages are divided into the following sections: Schema: Explains how our Schema works and the two key operations: Queries and Mutations Objects: A complete list of all objects in our schema, their definitions, what fields they use and when they are mandatory. role=“alert”>We are currently building out examples for every Object page. Please send us a Pull request if you would like to see an example for a particular Object, or if you would like to share your own example with the TravelgateX community.
[...]
